greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Period 3: repeat [1, 2, 3].
comment: Partial sums are given by A130481(n)+n+1. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jun 08 2007
Terms of the simple continued fraction for 3/(sqrt(37)-4). - _Paolo P. Lava_, Feb 16 2009
This is the lexicographically earliest sequence with no substring of more than 1 term being a palindrome. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Nov 24 2013
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,0,1).
Index entries for sequences that are fixed points of mappings
formula: a(n) = 6 - a(n-1) - a(n-2) for n > 1. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 13 2008
a(n) = n+1-3*floor(n/3) = floor(41*10^(n+1)/333)-floor(41*10^n/333)*10; a(n)-a(n-3)=0 with n>2. - _Bruno Berselli_, Jun 28 2010
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
